isis.stitle: REPAIR INSTRUCTIONS FOR FIBERGLASS AND PLASTIC (ABS) MATERIAL - FIBERGLASS - MATERIALS REQUIRED

svcsubproc.title: Fiberglass Mat
svcsubproc.para: This blanket of randomly arranged fibers is the repair material you will use in all repairs requiring a backing patch. Its weight is measured in ounces per square foot. For most of your repairs, a 1-1/2 oz. mat is required.

svcsubproc.title: Fiberglass Cloth
svcsubproc.para: This material is made from continuous filament glass fibers that are commercially woven on regular textile machinery. Fiberglass cloth is used where the most strength and the least thickness is needed. Its weight is measured in ounces per square yard. A 10 oz. cloth is recommended for most repairs.

svcsubproc.title: Resin
svcsubproc.para: Resin is a liquid plastic that hardens when combined with another substance known as a catalyst or hardener. The resin used for most fiberglass repairs is polyester resin. Because it is inexpensive and has a short hardening (curing) time, it is used for repairs requiring the pre-forming of a backing patch and is available at your local body equipment/paint outlets.

svcsubproc.title: Epoxy Adhesive
svcsubproc.para: This is the bonding cement used to create a strong durable bond between the back side of repair area and the backing patch. It is also used for bonding reinforcement panels to the back side of an outer panel. It is available at your local body equipment/paint outlets.

svcsubproc.title: Body Fillers
svcsubproc.para: Polyester body filler is used in most repair shops because it is easy to apply and shape to the contour of the surrounding piece. Machining of the body filler surface can be followed if necessary by an application of glazing putty to eliminate porosity and provide a smooth surface for painting. It is available from:
EVERCOAT - "RAGE" Autobody Polyester Filler: Fiberglass-Evercoat Co., Inc., 6600 Cornell Road, Cincinnati, OH 45242
SIKKENS - "POLYSOFT" Polyester Filler: Sikkens, AKZO Coating, Inc., 5555 Spalding Dr., Norcross, GA 30092
SPOT PUTTY:Evercoat - Ever-Glaze Spot Putty, Sikkens - Kombi Putty

As a matter of economy and to maintain the curing properties of the resin, store the resin in a sealed container within a cool, dry enclosure. This precaution will reduce aging caused by changing temperatures.
Keep a record of each purchase of resin. In this way, you can always use the oldest stock first.

note.para: The shelf life of resin varies; therefore, they should be tested before using and discarded if not up to specifications.
